name: Kim hyung
bio: Kim hyung been cooking for over 10 years and is known for his innovative twists on classic dishes

ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 cup green beans, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
recipes.method:
1. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the curry paste and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
2. Add the coconut milk and chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes.
3. Add the chicken and simmer for another 10 minutes or until cooked through.
4. Add the green beans and bell pepper and cook for another 5 minutes or until tender.
5. Serve with rice.

ingredients: 1 chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipes.method:
1. Soak the rice noodles in warm water for 10-15 minutes until softened.
2. Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the chicken and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until browned.
3. Add the garlic and stir-fry for another minute.
4. Push the chicken to one side of the pan and add the eggs to the other side. Scramble the eggs until just set.
5. Add the softened noodles and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until heated through.
6. Add the sauce and stir-fry for another minute.
7. Serve with peanuts, lime wedges, and cilantro.

1. In a large pot, bring the chicken stock to a boil.
2. Add the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and Korean chilies. Simmer for 5 minutes.
3. Add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes until pink and cooked through.
4. Serve hot.

name: Kim Goe Sung Joe
bio: Kim Goe Sung Joe grew up in a family of chefs and has been cooking professionally for 10 years. She specializes in cuisine.
